page.title: 22"Yoof" radio comes to Southend
page.content:
A radio station predates Essex Radio or even BBC local radio. Southend Action Radio was the “youth-wing” of TocH Hospital Radio, broadcasting on land line from studios in Westcliff. I know, because aged c17, I managed the station from 1966 to 1968. With one of the longest microphone cables I’ve ever seen, we got vox pops in the street, and borrowed a reel-to-reel portable tape machine for interviews at the Cliffs Pavilion. We never had any evidence anyone actually listened to our broadcasts!
David Heathcote
